. . . Seriously; with how much they're pissing off the average voter in 2016 they're going to be blown into oblivion and had the reaction of "Did anyone get the number of that dumptruck?"

topics.body:
"@Whatevs":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53a293156368724a66d20500#post_53a293156368724a66d20500
[bq="Whatevs"]"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53a2929c63687253ad6c0500#post_53a2929c63687253ad6c0500
If you really think the GOP will go away... Maybe as it exists currently but that is all. Nor would it be a bad thing.

And I'm fairly certain Hispanics vote Blue in Texas anyway, but I will google that[/bq]
Oh I have no doubt that the party will continue to exist, but as it currently is and what it stands for is going to go poof.  Like the anti-gay stances, the anti-voting rights stances and so forth are going to go poof.  They'll have to do some serious soul searching to become a electable party again and massively change their tune when it comes to minority rights.

Gay marriage is LITERALLY going to cost them the 2016 election and it's going to take them at least a decade and sucking up to voters for them to be electable as a party again.

topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53a293f163687215651f0200#post_53a293f163687215651f0200
It does appear that Hispanics vote Blue in Texas. There is not hugely reliable data on it though, it's all nationwide.

But my prediction has always been: the GOP will go in decline, a hibernation where it is taken over by the alt-right occurs.
The dems will become the new religious party as the white liberals will lost traction to demographic shifts and minorities tend to be religious and socially conservative.
This would not be that strange since humanism is the dems' religion anyway, and it is based largely off of Christian theology.

The alt-right GOP will probably leave the country, probably emigrating to Canada or Australia and form a secret blood drinking cabal.

Fun stuff
